name: goat
description: General purpose AT Protocol CLI in Go

readme.summary: Excellent technical documentation with comprehensive examples and installation options, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and detailed configuration reference.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common errors (authentication failures, network issues, API rate limits, etc.) and configuration options are scattered rather than systematically documented.

injection_risks.description: Potential SQL injection risk in comatproto.ServerGetSession function call, although the input is validated and sanitized before use.
Potential command injection risk in atclient.LoginWithPassword function call, but the input is validated and sanitized before use.

critical_findings: Potential SQL injection risk in comatproto.ServerGetSession function call
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and unvalidated input, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows best practices for secure coding.

common_complaints: Platform-specific bugs (macOS arm64 vs Linux x86_64 inconsistencies)
Windows/NTFS compatibility issues with special characters in filenames
Release build quality (dirty version numbers in production releases)
Feature incompleteness (missing PDS selection in blob operations, DNS validation failures)
praise_themes: Tool is useful enough that users are reporting detailed issues
Community is actively identifying edge cases and platform-specific problems
sentiment.summary: Goat has engaged users reporting legitimate bugs, but maintainers are responding inconsistently with some issues remaining unresolved for months, suggesting moderate maintenance rather than active development.

communication.summary: The responses are generally clear and helpful, showing a good level of technical depth and patience with the contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (indicates stale repository state)
19 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months showing no maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggesting release process is stalled
maintenance.summary: The goat package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite having unresolved open issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides, making it incomplete for users.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and provides a good overview of the package's functionality, but could benefit from more concise quick start instructions and better troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear troubleshooting section
Security: Potential SQL injection risk in comatproto.ServerGetSession function call
highlights: Recent commits and releases in the past month
Multiple contributors active over the last six months
A moderate number of open issues and PRs, indicating ongoing development
